title: How to Cook Packaged Macaroni and Cheese

steps.headline: Follow the directions on the box, which usually go something like this:
Now, to add some zing:

text:
Follow the directions on the box, which usually go something like this: Boil some water on the stove top. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":258,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":426.97802197802196,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Open the box, pull out the powder packet, and empty the macaroni into the pot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":259,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":428.02197802197804,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Bring to boil again, then let it boil for the allotted time (usually around 8 minutes). Stir the pasta occasionally (especially at first) so it doesn't stick to the bottom of the pan! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":258,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":426.97802197802196,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Strain the macaroni and put it back in the pot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":258,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":426.97802197802196,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Mix in the powdered cheese, milk and butter. Stir until it's all smooth. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a6/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a6/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":258,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":426.97802197802196,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Now, to add some zing: Turn the stove back on at a low setting, put the pot back on, and add your own cheese to the mix. Stir it up as it melts all over your meal. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":258,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":426.97802197802196,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add seasonings to taste: Simple things like salt & pepper are a start, but you can try others too, such as garlic powder and cumin. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":259,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":428.02197802197804,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut up a cooked hot dog into bite-size pieces, and add them to the macaroni. Or pieces of sliced ham from the deli are good too. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Cook-Packaged-Macaroni-and-Cheese-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":259,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":428.02197802197804,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finished.
